pageTitle: Machine Takes Season Sweep From Bayhawks | Ohio Machine Lacrosse
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {3793=The Ohio Machine used a fast start and an impeccable finish to pick up a Fourth of July victory against the Chesapeake Bayhawks at Selby Stadium., 443=The Machine will return to Selby Stadium on July 19 for the second game of a three-game home stand. Ohio will take on the Charlotte Hounds at 7 p.m. EST. After that, the Machine will paly the Denver Outlaws at 4:30 p.m. EST July 26. He helped lead a defensive stand that held Chesapeake scoreless for the final 2:19 of the game., 4078=By Tim Moody |  7/4/14 7:30 PM}
textBeforeTable: Related Articles: The Machine will return to Selby Stadium on July 19 for the second game of a three-game home stand. Ohio will take on the Charlotte Hounds at 7 p.m. EST. After that, the Machine will paly the Denver Outlaws at 4:30 p.m. EST July 26. Both games will be broadcast live on the CBS Sports Network. Chesapeake’s Joe Walters tallied four goals and four assists while Drew Westervelt and Ben Hunt each had four points in the loss. Bernhardt’s brother, Jesse, started the game on defense for the Bayhawks. Machine rookie midfielder Rob Guida scored his first career goal in the second quarter. After being acquired by the Machine in a trade with the New York Lizards on Wednesday, defenseman Steven Waldeck slotted directly into the lineup. He helped lead a defensive stand that held Chesapeake scoreless for the final 2:19 of the game. Goalie Brian Phipps made 12 saves on 26 shots faced. Face-off men Eric O’Brien and Bobby Dattilo combined to go 16-for-32 at the midfield X, with O’Brien finishing 10-of-17. Holman led the team with three goals and four points, while Baum had two goals and an assist. Harrison and Schreiber each added two goals for the victors and Schuss finished with two assists. Holman opened the fourth quarter with a goal as well, tying
